title: Laptop screen flickering after docking
body:
My Dell Latitude 5540 (SN: DL5540-2025-4892, Asset Tag: ACME-LT-1247) has been experiencing intermittent screen flickering when connected to my CalDigit TS4 Thunderbolt dock. The flickering occurs on my external Dell U2723QE monitor (connected via USB-C/DisplayPort) approximately every 10-15 minutes and lasts for 2-3 seconds each time. The laptop's built-in display is unaffected.

Environment:
- OS: Windows 11 Pro 24H2 (Build 26100.3194)
- Intel UHD Graphics driver: 31.0.101.5186
- Dock firmware: CalDigit TS4 v1.0.28
- Monitor firmware: Dell U2723QE M2T103
- USB-C cable: Belkin Thunderbolt 4 cable (2m)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Connect laptop to CalDigit TS4 dock via Thunderbolt 4
2. External monitor connected to dock via DisplayPort
3. Set external monitor as primary display at 3840x2160 @ 60Hz
4. Use normally for 10-15 minutes
5. Screen flickers/goes black for 2-3 seconds

What I've tried:
- Updated Intel graphics driver to latest version
- Tried a different USB-C cable (same issue)
- Reduced refresh rate to 30Hz (flickering stops but unusable)
- Reset display settings to default
- Tested with a different dock (Lenovo ThinkPad USB-C Dock) - same issue

This is significantly impacting my productivity as it interrupts screen recordings and video calls. I'm on the Engineering team (Floor 3, Desk 3-42) and need this resolved ASAP for a client demo next week.

title: Request new headset for remote work
body:
Hi IT team,

I recently transitioned to a hybrid schedule (3 days remote per week) and my current headset (Logitech H390 USB) is not cutting it for the volume of video calls I'm on daily (4-6 hours). The microphone picks up too much background noise from my home office and colleagues have complained about audio quality.

I'd like to request a Jabra Evolve2 75 wireless headset with ANC. I've confirmed with my manager (Sarah Kim, Marketing Director) that this is approved. I saw in the inventory that we have stock in HQ-Floor3-IT-Storage.

I'm based at HQ Floor 2, Desk 2-18 on my in-office days (Mon/Tue/Wed). Happy to pick it up from IT whenever it's ready.

Thanks!
- Priya Patel, Senior Marketing Manager

title: VPN connection drops every 30 minutes
body:
URGENT: My VPN connection (WireGuard) has been dropping exactly every 30 minutes since Monday (Feb 17). When it drops, I lose access to all internal systems for about 60-90 seconds before it automatically reconnects. This is causing major issues:

- Lost unsaved work in Confluence twice
- Dropped from 3 client Zoom calls mid-conversation
- SSH sessions to staging servers killed, disrupting deployments
- Cannot maintain persistent database connections

My setup:
- MacBook Pro 14" M3 Pro (macOS Sequoia 15.3)
- WireGuard v1.0.16 (latest from App Store)
- Home internet: Comcast 500/25 Mbps (stable, tested without VPN)
- Router: ASUS RT-AX86U (firmware 3.0.0.6.102)
- Config file: acme-wg-jrodriguez.conf (last rotated Jan 15, 2026)

Troubleshooting already performed:
1. Restarted WireGuard client multiple times
2. Rebooted laptop and router
3. Deleted and re-imported WireGuard config
4. Tried OpenVPN as fallback - same issue (drops at ~30 min intervals)
5. Tested on mobile hotspot (iPhone 15, T-Mobile) - SAME ISSUE
6. Reduced MTU to 1280 - no improvement
7. Disabled Wi-Fi power saving in System Settings
8. Checked PersistentKeepalive is set to 25

The fact that it happens on both WireGuard and OpenVPN, and on both home Wi-Fi and mobile hotspot, suggests the issue might be server-side. Two colleagues on my team (Alex Wu and Dana Park) reported similar issues starting this week.

I'm a Senior DevOps Engineer on the Platform team and this is blocking production deployment work. Please escalate.

- James Rodriguez, Senior DevOps Engineer, Platform Team

title: Software license renewal - Adobe Creative Cloud
body:
Our Adobe Creative Cloud for Teams subscription is up for renewal on March 15, 2026. We currently have 15 seats assigned across the Design and Marketing departments.

Current license details:
- Plan: Adobe Creative Cloud for Teams - All Apps
- Seats: 15
- Annual cost: $13,428.00 ($74.60/seat/month x 15 seats x 12 months)
- Account admin: David Chen (david.chen@acmecorp.com)
- Adobe contract #: ETLA-2025-AC-78432

Current seat assignments:
- Design team: 8 seats (all actively used)
- Marketing team: 5 seats (4 actively used, 1 underutilized)
- Product team: 2 seats (both actively used)

Action items:
1. Confirm renewal with Adobe rep (contact: jessica.huang@adobe.com)
2. Review seat utilization - we may be able to drop to 14 seats (saving ~$895/year)
3. Evaluate whether any users can switch to the cheaper Photography plan ($263.88/seat/year)
4. Process PO through Procurement (PO approval needed from VP Design, Rachel Torres)
5. Update license in the IT asset management system

Budget: This was allocated in the FY2026 IT software budget under line item SW-ADOBE-001.

Please initiate the renewal process at least 2 weeks before expiration to avoid service interruption. Last year we had a 3-day lapse and it disrupted the Design team's sprint.

- David Chen, IT Procurement Specialist

title: Printer on Floor 2 not responding
body:
The shared printer on Floor 2 (near the kitchen area) is not responding to any print jobs. Multiple people on the floor have reported the issue this morning.

Printer details:
- Model: HP LaserJet Pro M404dn
- Asset Tag: ACME-PR-0042
- Location: HQ Floor 2, Kitchen Alcove (Room 2-K1)
- IP Address: 10.10.2.50
- Hostname: hq-f2-printer-01.acmecorp.internal

Symptoms:
- Print jobs sent from any computer show as "queued" but never print
- Printer control panel displays: Error code 49.4C02 (firmware error)
- Front panel LCD shows "Ready" for a moment then cycles to the error
- Network ping to 10.10.2.50 responds normally
- Printer web interface (http://10.10.2.50) loads but shows "Printer State: Error"

What we've tried:
- Power cycled the printer (unplugged for 60 seconds, plugged back in)
- Error returns after approximately 2 minutes
- Cleared the print queue on the print server
- Checked paper trays - all loaded (Tray 1: Letter, Tray 2: Letter)
- Toner level: ~45% remaining (should not be an issue)

This printer serves about 30 people on Floor 2. The nearest alternative is on Floor 3 (Room 3-C2) which is inconvenient for everyone here. Accounting in particular needs to print client invoices by end of day.

- Tom Nakamura, Office Manager, Facilities
